phrasetype.name: Noun
phrasetype.phrase: Language, Package, Module, Name, and PhraseType

phrasetype.name: Message

phrase.name: deleteinstaller
phrase.regularexpression: Archon will not function until packages\/core\/install\/install\.php has been deleted\.

phrasetype.phrase: Archon will not function until package/core/install/install.php has been deleted.

phrase.name: error_parse_pleasefollowformat
phrase.regularexpression: Unable to parse ([\w]+). Please follow the example format\.

phrasetype.phrase: Unable to parse $1. Please follow the example format.

phrase.name: error_reason_alreadyinstalled
phrase.regularexpression: A Package with the same APRCode is already installed\.

phrasetype.phrase: A Package with the same APRCode is already installed.

phrase.name: error_reason_cannotdisablecore
phrase.regularexpression: The Archon Core Package cannot be disabled\.

phrasetype.phrase: The Archon Core Package cannot be disabled.

phrase.name: error_reason_codebasenotfound
phrase.regularexpression: The ([\w\s]+) Package codebase could not be found\.

phrasetype.phrase: The $1 Package codebase could not be found.

phrase.name: error_reason_nodelete
phrase.regularexpression: Unable to delete from the database table\.

phrasetype.phrase: Unable to delete from the database table.

phrase.name: error_reason_noexistdatabase
phrase.regularexpression: ([\w]+)( [\w\d]+)?( [\w\d]+)? does not exist in the database\.

phrasetype.phrase: $1$2$3 does not exist in the database.

phrase.name: error_reason_noinsert
phrase.regularexpression: Unable to insert into the database table\.

phrasetype.phrase: Unable to insert into the database table.

phrase.name: error_reason_notsametype
phrase.regularexpression: Variables are not of the same type\.

phrasetype.phrase: Variables are not of the same type.

phrase.name: error_reason_noupdate
phrase.regularexpression: Unable to update the database table\.

phrasetype.phrase: Unable to update the database table.

phrase.name: error_reason_packagedependencynotenabled
phrase.regularexpression: Package ([\w\s]+) depends upon Package ([\w\s]+) which is not enabled\.

phrasetype.phrase: Package $1 depends upon Package $2 which is not enabled.

phrase.name: error_reason_packagedependencynotinstalled
phrase.regularexpression: Package ([\w\s]+) depends upon Package ([\w\s]+) which is not installed\.

phrasetype.phrase: Package $1 depends upon Package $2 which is not installed.

phrase.name: error_reason_packagewrongversion
phrase.regularexpression: Package ([\w]+) version ([\d.]+) must be installed \(installed version is ([\d.]+)\)\.

phrasetype.phrase: Package $1 version $2 must be installed (installed version is $3).

phrase.name: error_reason_primaryrepository
phrase.regularexpression: ([\w]+) may only be altered for the primary repository\.

phrasetype.phrase: $1 may only be altered for the primary repository.

phrase.name: error_reason_repeatinfo
phrase.regularexpression: A ([\w]+) with the same ([\w]+) already exists in the database\.

phrasetype.phrase: A $1 with the same $2 already exists in the database.

phrase.name: error_reason_requiresnewer
phrase.regularexpression: Package ([\w]+) requires Package ([\w]+) version ([\w.]+) or newer \(installed version is ([\w.]+)\)\.

phrasetype.phrase: Package $1 requires Package $2 version $3 or newer (installed version is $4).

phrase.name: error_reason_saaccount
phrase.regularexpression: The sa account can only be altered from the Archon Configuration module\.

phrasetype.phrase: The sa account can only be altered from the Archon Configuration module.

phrase.name: error_reason_scriptnoexist
phrase.regularexpression: Script ([\w]+) does not exist in Package ([\w]+)\.

phrasetype.phrase: Script $1 does not exist in Package $2.

phrase.name: error_registerfile
phrase.regularexpression: Could not register file for class ([\w]+)

phrasetype.phrase: Could not register file for class $1

phrase.name: error_root_templatenotdefined
phrase.regularexpression: ([\w]+) template not defined for template set ([\w]+)\.

phrasetype.phrase: $1 template not defined for template set $2.

phrase.name: newpackageversion
phrase.regularexpression: A newer version of the ([\w]+) package has been released, visit <a href='http:\/\/www\.archon\.org\/'>www\.archon\.org<\/a> to upgrade\.

phrasetype.phrase: A newer version of the $1 package has been released, visit www.archon.org to upgrade.

phrase.name: newversion
phrase.regularexpression: A newer version of Archon has been released, visit <a href="http:\/\/www\.archon\.org\/">www\.archon\.org<\/a> to upgrade\.

phrasetype.phrase: A newer version of Archon has been released, visit www.archon.org to upgrade.

phrase.name: upgradepackage
phrase.regularexpression: Package ([\w]+) is out of date\. Please run the upgrade script in the Package Manager\.

phrasetype.phrase: Package $1 is out of date. Please run the upgrade script in the Package Manager.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: The "Browse" tab is used to view/search all available records in the database.
This is the message displayed to users in the message frame when they initally log in.
Enables the ability to check archon.org for updates to Archon.
This determines the formatting of displayed dates. Formatting used should correspond to PHP's date function as specified at "http://www.php.net/date".
This value will determine what theme should be used for the look of Archon's Administrative Interface.
This value specifies the default language.
Sets the default page that should come up whenever somebody first accesses the Archon Public Interface.
The selected template set will be the default template set used in output documents.
The selected theme will be the default theme used in the public display.
If Public Enabled is set to No, this message will be displayed to users in place of the Archon system.

It is highly recommended that this directive remains enabled. When enabled, this directive allows Archon to use BBCode formatting and valid XHTML while displaying information from records in the both the public and administrative interface.
The Installation ID is a unique number generated when Archon is initally installed.
This is the message that will be displayed to users when prompted to log in.
If enabled, Archon will log database table changes and the user responsible for each change.
Enables the public output system for Archon. To temporarily disable the system, set this value to No.
If enabled, public users will be able to register an account to use for research, etc.
This value determines the length above which strings will be truncated in a related option frame (ie. the subject frame in the collections manager)
This password will allow an administrator to log in with full privileges. The sa account should only be used when administrators are unable to log on with their individual credentials.
This value will limit the number of results returned by default on all searches in the Archon system.
Click on the question mark icons or select fields to receive help.
Use "General" tab to view an existing record or create a new record.
The Phrase XML import script takes phrase xml files and imports them to the phrase table.

phrasetype.name: Administrative Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: Copyright ©$1 [url=http://www.uiuc.edu/]The University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign[/url]
Are you sure you want to delete this record?
Are you sure you want to delete this record AND all of its children?

Archon began development in the fall of 2003 at [url=http://www.library.uiuc.edu/sousa/]The Sousa Archives[/url] as a low budget project to establish a web presence for the archives. After the initial prototype was put into production, the project received the support of the [url=http://web.library.uiuc.edu/ahx/]University Archives[/url] and [url=http://www.library.uiuc.edu/]University Library[/url] and was remodeled to be a flexible application which could easily be implemented at other archival institutions. The project has since expanded in scope, and has become a standards-compliant system which is easily managed and offers numerous commonly used methods for the import and export of archival data.
Right click on tree nodes to activate context menu

phrasetype.name: Public Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: Your search yielded too many results and we limited the number shown. Try adding more search terms!
Your search did not return any results. Please revise your query and try again.
$1 Hits! Click the links to show each category's results.
$1 Hit! Click the links to show each category's results.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Open 'Advanced Permissions' section to assign specific permissions for the user in question. Use the check boxes to specify what permissions the user should have for each module.
In order for the addition or update to succeed, the value entered here must be the same as the password in the field above.
Use this field to record the user's name. The value entered here will be displayed in messages provided in Archon's administrative interface.
Enter or edit the user's email address.
Enter or edit the user's first name.

The User Manager is used to add or delete logins for individuals who have permission to access Archon's administrative interface. It is also used to define the levels of authority that specific users have to edit, add, or delete information in each of the Archon modules.
Users should be assigned to a base user group. They will inherit the default permissions of that group, but permissions can be tailored for specific users if necessary, by using the "Advanced Permissions Editor."

Use this field to select the language the user will see while navigating the administrative interface. If translations for that language are not available, the default language as chosen in the Configuration Manager will be used instead.
Enter or edit the user's last name.
Use this field to lock a user, i.e. to deny him or her access to the administrative interface.
Use this field to record the login name that will be associated with a particular administrative user.
Use this field to record or change a user's login password.

Open 'Repositories' section to link repositories to the user. Either double click on any repository name in left box to link it with the user or after highlighting a repository name, use the right arrow to link it to the User. Use the left arrow to unlink the repository. CTRL-click selects multiple repositories and SHIFT-click or or mouse left click and drag select a range of items.
Use this field to create secure connection.

Open 'User Groups' section to link user groups to the user. Either double click on any user group in left box to link it with the user or after highlighting a user group name, use the right arrow to link it to the user. Use the left arrow to unlink the user group. CTRL-click selects multiple user groups and SHIFT-click or or mouse left click and drag select a range of items.
Use this field to allow or disallow users from viewing, adding, and updating collection records in Archon repositories, other than the primary one to which he/she is assigned.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use this field to identify database IP address, name, login, and size.

Use the drop-down list to export the database. The first field contains a list of SQL server types. Choose the one your system is running in order to ensure that the database can be successfully restored at a later date, if necessary. This field affects exports of both the full database and individual tables. Click the button to initiate an export.
Use the 'Database Manger' to import or export the database, or to view information about the SQL Server or Mysql database in which your Archon data is stored.

Use these utilities to import data into the Archon database. Select an import utility from those listed below and then identify how the data should be imported using the questions supplied to you by the utility. Locally-developed import scripts can be uploaded to Archon's admin/databases folder. Once uploaded, they will appear in this list.
If you choose to develop a local script, use the existing scripts as a template; the scripts will fail unless structured properly.

Use these utilities to import data into the Archon database. Select an import utility from those listed below and then identify how the data should be imported using the questions supplied to you by the utility. Locally-developed import scripts can be uploaded to Archon's admin/databases folder. Once uploaded, they will appear in this list.
If you choose to develop a local script, use the existing scripts as a template; the scripts will fail unless structured properly.
Use this utility to identify table name and number of records within each one of the tables.

phrasetype.name: Administrative Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: The following Import Utilities have been installed
This utility requires a file as input
Select files in the incoming directory

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: The 'Permissions" utility is used to assign specific permissions for the usergroup in question. Use the check boxes to specify what permissions the usergroup should have for each module.
Use these check boxes to define permission levels associated with a group of users who have access to Archon's administrative interface.

The Usergroup Manager is used to define the levels of administrative authority associated with the defined groups of users. This controls their ability to add, edit, or delete records in particular Archon modules.
Use this field to record or modify the name associated with a particular usergroup.
The "Users" utility is used to assign specific user[s] to a usergroup[s].

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use these two fields to record the street or postal address of your repository.
Use this field to record the name of the chief administrator for your repository.
Use these fields to record the city, state, and zip code for your repository.
Use this field to record the Organization Code or for your repository. See http://www.loc.gov/marc/organizations/ for more information on MARC repository codes.
Use this field to associate the repository to a country.
Use this field to record the e-mail address of your repository.
Enter the signature line you wish to use at the end of email messages sent by Archon to end users.
Use this field to record the fax number of your repository.
The Repository Manager is used to define the name(s) and other details of your repository or repositories for which your installation of Archon includes descriptive records.
Use this field to record the official name of your repository.
Use these fields to record a phone number and, optionally, a phone extension, for your repository.

Use this field to define which research functionality you would like to employ for this repository. Enabling Collection research features allows the use of the research cart and appointment manager, and enabling Digital Library research features allows the use of the high-resolution request link.
Use this field to force collections within this repository to display a certain template set.

Use this field to record the URL for the installation of Archon.
The URL MUST be an absolute URL, and must include a slash at the end of the directory containing archon.
The "User" utility associates specific user[s] to specific repository[ies].

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase:
Use these fields to record the order in which checked widgets will display on your homepage.
Widgets with a lower number will appear closer to the top of your administrative homepage.
Use this module to set the display properties for your 'homepage' in the Archon Administrative interface

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Click any of the headings listed below to set configuration options for your installation of Archon.
Use this utility to identify the tables and number of records within each one of the tables.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use the Sessions Manager to view and/or terminate any database connections that are currently open.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: This page provides information about Archon and a list of credits for those who helped with product development.

phrasetype.name: Administrative Phrase
phrasetype.phrase:
[b]Project Staff[/b]: Chris Prom, Assistant University Archivist, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign; Scott Schwartz, Director & Archivist, The Sousa Archives and Center for American Music, University of Illinois; Paul Sorensen, Lead Developer, University of Illinois Department of Computer Science; Kyle Fox, Former Lead Developer (July 2007-August 2008), University of Illinois Department of Computer Science; Chris Rishel, Former Lead Developer (prior to July 2007), University of Chicago.
[b]Special Thanks[/b]: Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, University of Illinois Library Executive Committee, Teresa Brinati, Adriana Cuervo, Naun Chew Chait, Lynn Holdzkom, Sharif Islam, Paula Kaufman, Christoffer Landtman, Adam Lewenberg, John McEntire, William Maher, Pamela Nye, Deborra Richardson, Beth Sandore, Karen Schmidt, Carl Snow, Purdue University, Linda Stahnke, Peggy Steele, Ellen Swain, John Weible, Kathy Wisser.
Citations from [url=http://www.archivists.org/catalog/pubDetail.asp?objectID=1279][i]Describing Archives: a Content Standard[/i][/url] are reprinted with permission of the [url=http://www.archivists.org]Society of American Archivists[/url].

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: The Phrase Manager is used to edit the help button messages ('descriptions'), error messages ('messages') and Archon field and class names displayed to administrative users of the Archon system.
Use this field to specify the language of the phrase being added or updated.
Use this menu to select the module associated with this phrases. If a module is selected, it must match the above package.
Use this field to specify the Archon Package associated with the phrase.

Use this field to record the name of the phrase you want to add or update.
Under normal circumstances, the names of fields should not be changed, since doing so may break certain aspects of Archon.

Use this drop-down list to differentiate the types of phrases managed in the Phrase Manager.
The value should be set to 'description' for help button texts, and 'message' for error messages.
Field and Class names should not be edited under normal circumstances.

Use this field to record the text to be displayed or processed when the associated object is called by the Archon scripts.
The associated help buttons and error messages to display the values recorded here.

Use this field to record a regular expression that Archon's scripts will use when processing the field and class names associated with the phrase.
Normally, the values should not be changed.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use "Additional" utility to identify the packages below that are not fully installed. Use the buttons below to install packages that have their dependencies installed and enabled.

Below are a list of installed Archon packages. Use the buttons to enable/disable or uninstall individual packages.
Note that you can only disable or uninstall packages that do not have an enabled package depending on them.

Use the "Installed" utility to identify list of installed Archon packages. Use the buttons to enable/disable or uninstall individual packages.
Note that you can only disable or uninstall packages that do not have an enabled package depending on them.

phrasetype.name: Administrative Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: This will irreversibly delete ALL DATA associated with this package! Are you sure you want to do this?
Are you sure you want to install the $1 package? (You should backup your data in the database manager first.)
This will irreversibly delete ALL DATA associated with the $1 package! Are you sure you want to do this? (You should backup your data in the database manager first.)
This will update the database to use a newer version of the $1 package. Are you sure you want to do this? (You should backup your data in the database manager first.)
Visit [url=$1]The Archon Project Website[/url] to download additional packages.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase:
The Modification Log can be used to view changes made by users in the Administrative Interface.
Use the 'search' field to search against any of the columns and use the arrow buttons to sort the list of modifications by column, either ascending or descending.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use this field to change the display order of the content.
User Profile Fields Manager is used to define fields for a user profile.
Use this field to select the type of user profile field.
Use this field to select the function if it is a pre-populated select box.
Use this field to specify maximum length of the string in the user profile field.
Use this field to select the pakage for which you are creating user profile.
Use this field to select the pattern type for the profile field. i.e whether data of the field is text type, boolean etc.
Mark this field 'Yes', if it is a required user profile field.
Use this field to provide the size for the text field of user profile field.
Mark this field 'No', if it is a readonly user profile field.
Use this field to provide the name for user profile field.
Use this field to categorize the profile information.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: The Pattern Manager is used to establish how information can be formatted.
Use this field to specify the name of the pattern.
Use this field to specify the Archon Package to associate a specific pattern to.
Use this field to specify the format of the information.
Use this section to test the regular expression against several patterns.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use the Region Manager to describe and store the region (state, province, territory, etc.) name and abbreviation for a country.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use User Profile Field Categories Manager to define/create categories for User profile.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: In order for the addition or update to succeed, the value entered here must be the same as the password in the field above.
Use this field to select the country for the user.
Use this field to record the user's name. The value entered here will be displayed in messages provided in Archon's administrative interface.
Enter or edit the user's email address.
Enter or edit the user's first name.

The Public User Manager is used to add or delete logins for public individuals who have permission to access Archon's administrative interface. It is also used to define the levels of authority that specific user allow to access on the Archon modules.

Use this field to select the language the user will see while navigating the administrative interface. If translations for that language are not available, the default language as chosen in the Configuration Manager will be used instead.
Enter or edit the user's last name.
Use this field to lock a user, i.e. to deny him or her access to the administrative interface.
Use this field to record the login name that will be associated with a particular administrative user.
Use this field to record or change a user's login password.
Check 'Yes' to indicate the public user's account as pending. When an account is pending, the public user cannot submit a request to checkout materials.
Use this field to create secure connection.

phrasetype.name: Administrative Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: Would you like to receive updates?
